clinical_study.brief_title: Study of an Experimental New Drug, PPAR Agonist Taken by Mouth by Patients With Advanced or Metastatic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Dose Finding Study of an Experimental New Drug, PPAR Agonist Taken by Mouth by Patients With Advanced or Metastatic Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: An open-label, Phase I, dose escalation study of CS-7017 administered by mouth in sequential cohorts of 3 to 6 patients with advanced or metastatic malignancies.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine a RP2D for CS-7017 administered orally twice daily to patients with advanced or metastatic malignancies.

secondary_outcome.measure: To document the safety profile of CS-7017 administered orally twice daily;
To assess the PK of repeated oral doses of CS-7017 activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: weekly for the first 4 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: To explore potential biomarkers of CS-7017 activity
To make preliminary assessments of the anti-tumor effects of CS-7107 administered twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically or cytologically diagnosed advanced or metastatic malignancy that is refractory to, not curable with, or not eligible for standard treatment(s).
- 18 years or older
- ECOG performance status less than or equal to 2.
- Resolution of any toxic effects of prior therapy (except alopecia) to NCI CTCAE v3.0 grade less than or equal to 1.
- Adequate organ and bone marrow function.
- Willing to use effective contraceptive while on treatment through at least 3 months thereafter.
- Negative pregnancy test for females of childbearing potential.
- Echocardiogram with EF within normal range.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure or radiation therapy during the study.
- Treatment with chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, other TZDs, radiotherapy, minor surgery, or any investigational agent within 4 wks (6 wks for nitrosoureas, mitomycin C, immunotherapy, biological therapy, or major surgery) of study treatment start.
- Patients with clinically significant pleural or pericardial effusion (patients with minimal pleural effusion may be eligible at the Investigator's discretion).
- Clinically significant active infection, which requires antibiotic therapy, or HIV-positive patients receiving antiretroviral therapy.
